context_bundle.summary: Data processing pipelines: ELT (Extract-Load-Transform) vs ETL patterns. Modern: Zero-ETL (query in place), 5-layer streaming (sources->ingestion->processing->storage->consumption). Platforms: Kafka, Kinesis, Flink for millions events/sec.

onboarding.quick_start: ELT = Extract, Load, Transform (cloud-native). ETL = Extract, Transform, Load (traditional). Zero-ETL = query data in place. Streaming: Kafka (10M+ events/sec), Kinesis (AWS managed), Pub/Sub (GCP). 5 layers: sources, ingest, process, store, consume.
common_patterns: ELT: Cloud warehouse transforms after load (Snowflake, BigQuery)
Kafka: Distributed log, millions events/sec, 10-100ms latency
Zero-ETL: Redshift Spectrum, BigQuery Omni query federated data
Batch: Schedule transforms, good for historical analysis

known_errors.cause: Transform layer can't keep up with ingestion rate
known_errors.solution: Scale processing layer (Flink cluster), partition data, optimize transforms
